channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In France, Investors Get the Centrist Limbo They Wanted
item.description: Polarization has for years left the country’s politics stuck in an unpopular middle ground, and the latest elections won’t change that. But it does se...

item.title: Airline stocks gain as daily travelers top 3 million, exceeding 2019 high
item.description: The airline sector traded mostly higher Monday, after data showed there were more travelers at the end of the July 4 weekend than on any day last year...

item.title: Japan's $1.5 Trillion Pension Whale to Trigger Waves in Stocks, Currencies
item.description: Many analysts say Tokyo is getting ready to redirect some of its stash of dollars back into yen assets—a decision that could ripple through global fin...

item.title: As bitcoin keeps falling, an S&P 500 correction could be close behind
item.description: The recent weakness of bitcoin could signal an imminent correction of the S&P 500 in the summer, as the two assets often trade in tandem.

item.title: Where Have All the Good Stocks Gone?
item.description: With prices at records, there are fewer to buy, and the quality of remaining ones is surprisingly bad. Blame years of low interest rates.

item.title: Paramount’s stock falls and bonds rally as company seals buyout deal with Skydance Media
item.description: “It’s the old ‘buy the rumor, sell the news’ adage,” says a market source.

item.title: Vanguard's Die-Hard Customers Have a Message for New CEO: 'The Service Is Abysmal'
item.description: Salim Ramji takes the helm Monday, and many clients are hoping he will fix customer service.

item.title: S&P 500 rally is ‘unusually strong’ in 2024. Here’s why stocks may keep rising.
item.description: The U.S. stock market’s rally is facing a test that begins this week with company earnings.

item.title: French Stocks Recover From Initial Fall After Leftist Alliance Win
item.description: French stocks rose while government bonds fell in early trading after a party alliance led by the far-left emerged first in the country’s parliamentar...

item.title: What it’s like to be audited by the bigger, better-funded IRS. ‘They are pushing harder now.’
item.description: The Internal Revenue Service is showing more ‘swagger’ in audits of rich taxpayers, says one lawyer with ultra-wealthy clients
